definitions.text: a projectile that is fired from a gun
a unit of mass equal to the mass that accelerates at 1 foot/sec/sec when acted upon by a force of 1 pound; approximately 14.5939 kilograms
an amount of an alcoholic drink (usually liquor) that is poured or gulped
examples: he took a slug of hard liquor

definitions.text: a strip of type metal used for spacing
any of various terrestrial gastropods having an elongated slimy body and no external shell

examples: I gave him a clout on his nose

definitions.text: strike heavily, especially with the fist or a bat
examples: He slugged me so hard that I passed out

definitions.text: be idle; exist in a changeless situation
examples: The old man sat and stagnated on his porch
He slugged in bed all morning
